title: Blood
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

*For the obsolete item, see [potion of blood](/Potion_of_blood "Potion of blood").*

**Blood** is a liquid present within most [natural](/Natural "Natural") creatures.

## Contents

- [1 What has blood](#What_has_blood)
- [2 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
  - [2.1 Blood temperature](#Blood_temperature)
- [3 History](#History)

## What has blood

Most player [species](/Species "Species") have blood. The player species who don't are: [undead](/Undead "Undead") species ([Ghoul](/Ghoul "Ghoul"), [Mummy](/Mummy "Mummy"), bloodless [Vampire](/Vampire "Vampire")), [Gargoyle](/Gargoyle "Gargoyle"), and [Djinni](/Djinni "Djinni"). Players may turn into a plant, nonliving, or undead [transformation](/Transformation "Transformation") ([Tree Form](/Tree_Form "Tree Form"), [Statue Form](/Statue_Form "Statue Form"), [Storm Form](/Storm_Form "Storm Form"), [Death Form](/Death_Form "Death Form")...), which removes blood while it lasts.

[Draconians](/Draconian "Draconian") and players in [Serpent Form](/Serpent_Form "Serpent Form") are cold-blooded.

Most monsters that are [natural](/Natural "Natural"), and that are not [insects](/List_of_insects "List of insects"), [arachnids](/List_of_arachnids "List of arachnids"), [jellies](/List_of_jellies "List of jellies"), or [eyeballs](/List_of_eyeballs "List of eyeballs"), have blood. Some non-natural monsters, such as [vampires](/List_of_vampires "List of vampires"), will also have blood. If a monster has either the "warm-blooded" or "cold-blooded" tag, it has blood.

## Useful Info

While blood seems cosmetic, creating blood splatters all over the Dungeon floor, it is used for a few mechanics within the game:

- The spell [Sublimation of Blood](/Sublimation_of_Blood "Sublimation of Blood") can only be cast if you are in a form with blood.
- Vampiric attack flavours (e.g. attacks from [vampires](/Vampire_\(monster\) "Vampire (monster)"); *not* including the [vampiric](/Vampiric "Vampiric") weapon brand) only work on a target with blood.
- [Skysharks](/Skyshark "Skyshark") check for blood with their [Bloodzerk](/Attack_flavour#Bloodzerk "Attack flavour") attack flavour. If a Bloodzerk deals damage to a target with blood, the skyshark will gain [might](/Might "Might") for a short period. If the skyshark damages a valid target with bloodzerk again, it will go [berserk](/Berserk "Berserk").
- The player [demonspawn mutation](/Demonspawn_mutation "Demonspawn mutation"), [Ignite Blood](/Ignite_Blood "Ignite Blood") will create flame [clouds](/Cloud "Cloud") whenever blood would splatter.

### Blood temperature

Creatures with blood can either be **cold-blooded** or **warm-blooded**:

- Cold-blooded creatures have a 50% chance of being [slowed](/Slow "Slow") when they are damaged by any of the following cold sources: [Freezing](/Freezing "Freezing")-[branded](/Brand "Brand") melee and ranged attacks, [Freeze](/Freeze "Freeze"), [Frozen Ramparts](/Frozen_Ramparts "Frozen Ramparts"), [Ozocubu's Refrigeration](/Ozocubu%27s_Refrigeration "Ozocubu's Refrigeration"), and [freezing vapour](/Freezing_Cloud "Freezing Cloud").

* In addition, cold-blooded monsters are slowed twice as long by [Metabolic Englaciation](/Metabolic_Englaciation "Metabolic Englaciation").

- Warm-blooded creatures have no specific vulnerabilities (other than having blood in the first place).

## History

- Prior to [0.24](/0.24 "0.24"), [Vampires](/Vampire "Vampire") would drink [potions of blood](/Potions_of_blood "Potions of blood") in place of regular [food](/Food "Food").
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), creatures with blood were vulnerable to the bleeding status.
html:
Blood

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

For the obsolete item, see potion of blood.

Blood is a liquid present within most natural creatures.

Contents

  • 1 What has blood
  • 2 Useful Info
    • 2.1 Blood temperature
  • 3 History

What has blood

Most player species have blood. The player species who don't are: undead species (Ghoul, Mummy, bloodless Vampire), Gargoyle, and Djinni. Players may turn into a plant, nonliving, or undead transformation (Tree Form, Statue Form, Storm Form, Death Form...), which removes blood while it lasts.

Draconians and players in Serpent Form are cold-blooded.

Most monsters that are natural, and that are not insects, arachnids, jellies, or eyeballs, have blood. Some non-natural monsters, such as vampires, will also have blood. If a monster has either the "warm-blooded" or "cold-blooded" tag, it has blood.

Useful Info

While blood seems cosmetic, creating blood splatters all over the Dungeon floor, it is used for a few mechanics within the game:

  • The spell Sublimation of Blood can only be cast if you are in a form with blood.
  • Vampiric attack flavours (e.g. attacks from vampires; not including the vampiric weapon brand) only work on a target with blood.
  • Skysharks check for blood with their Bloodzerk attack flavour. If a Bloodzerk deals damage to a target with blood, the skyshark will gain might for a short period. If the skyshark damages a valid target with bloodzerk again, it will go berserk.
  • The player demonspawn mutation, Ignite Blood will create flame clouds whenever blood would splatter.

Blood temperature

Creatures with blood can either be cold-blooded or warm-blooded:

  • Cold-blooded creatures have a 50% chance of being slowed when they are damaged by any of the following cold sources: Freezing-branded melee and ranged attacks, Freeze, Frozen Ramparts, Ozocubu's Refrigeration, and freezing vapour.
In addition, cold-blooded monsters are slowed twice as long by Metabolic Englaciation.
  • Warm-blooded creatures have no specific vulnerabilities (other than having blood in the first place).

History

  • Prior to 0.24, Vampires would drink potions of blood in place of regular food.
  • Prior to 0.17, creatures with blood were vulnerable to the bleeding status.

rawPage:
{{version031}}
''For the obsolete item, see [[potion of blood]].''

'''Blood''' is a liquid present within most [[natural]] creatures. 

==What has blood==
Most player [[species]] have blood. The player species who don't are: [[undead]] species ([[Ghoul]], [[Mummy]], bloodless [[Vampire]]), [[Gargoyle]], and [[Djinni]]. Players may turn into a plant, nonliving, or undead [[transformation]] ([[Tree Form]], [[Statue Form]], [[Storm Form]], [[Death Form]]...), which removes blood while it lasts.

[[Draconian]]s and players in [[Serpent Form]] are cold-blooded.

Most monsters that are [[natural]], and that are not [[list of insects|insects]], [[list of arachnids|arachnids]], [[list of jellies|jellies]], or [[list of eyeballs|eyeballs]], have blood. Some non-natural monsters, such as [[list of vampires|vampires]], will also have blood. If a monster has either the "warm-blooded" or "cold-blooded" tag, it has blood.

==Useful Info==
While blood seems cosmetic, creating blood splatters all over the Dungeon floor, it is used for a few mechanics within the game:

*The spell [[Sublimation of Blood]] can only be cast if you are in a form with blood.
*Vampiric attack flavours (e.g. attacks from [[vampire (monster)|vampires]]; ''not'' including the [[vampiric]] weapon brand) only work on a target with blood.
*[[Skyshark]]s check for blood with their [[Attack flavour#Bloodzerk|Bloodzerk]] attack flavour. If a Bloodzerk deals damage to a target with blood, the skyshark will gain [[might]] for a short period. If the skyshark damages a valid target with bloodzerk again, it will go [[berserk]].
*The player [[demonspawn mutation]], [[Ignite Blood]] will create flame [[cloud]]s whenever blood would splatter.

===Blood temperature===
Creatures with blood can either be '''cold-blooded''' or '''warm-blooded''':

*Cold-blooded creatures have a 50% chance of being [[slow]]ed when they are damaged by any of the following cold sources: [[Freezing]]-[[brand]]ed melee and ranged attacks, [[Freeze]], [[Frozen Ramparts]], [[Ozocubu's Refrigeration]], and [[Freezing Cloud|freezing vapour]].
:In addition, cold-blooded monsters are slowed twice as long by [[Metabolic Englaciation]].

*Warm-blooded creatures have no specific vulnerabilities (other than having blood in the first place).

==History==
*Prior to [[0.24]], [[Vampire]]s would drink [[potions of blood]] in place of regular [[food]].
*Prior to [[0.17]], creatures with blood were vulnerable to the bleeding status.
